description.p: They are a clever people with love for tricks, glee, and food. Haling from the Ever Gleam, these curious creatures are magical by nature. Each "born" connected to a season or tasked with defending the natural world. Fairies are broken into two kinds, Pixies and Sprites. In the Ever Gleam Pixies tend to the natural world's cycle's, actively. Pixies are fairies tied to the seasons. While sprites are connected defending the natural world and work against unnatural threats. While most lump them into one group of playful tricksters this is not the case. All pixies love to play tricks, be merry, and enjoy living; but the severity changes with each season. The season of the pixie is based on the season of the year. Spring fairies tend to be the most innocent and playful. Summer fairies have the most energy and tend to enjoy tricks. Autumn Fairies tend to be fickle and their tricks can leave someone as a "fool". Winter fairies are the most reserved and tend to only play tricks as lessons, and those lessons can on occasion leave someone hurt. Sprites are tied to the landscape. Taking on characteristics of the land they inhabit. While humanoid they are not "little-people". They do eat, but its a diet of plants, flowers, and spices that other races would call inedible or poisonous.
They tend to stand about 9 inches through 1'3" tall and weigh about as much as a kitten.

Colors tend to hold to their season, but the colors vary wildly. (Though any color is possible.) Their skin stands between fair, tan, dark, or even strange colors. Many fairies love to dress simply, but simple does not mean boring. Their wings can be any color and the shapes tend to range from butterfly wings to moth wings.
Faerie are considered children until they reach some form of maturity unrecognizable by non-Fey.

On declaring adulthood, an elf selects an adult name, although those who knew him or her as a youngster might continue to use the child name. Each elf’s adult name is a unique creation, though it might reflect the names of respected individuals or other family members. Little distinction exists between male names and female names; the groupings here reflect only general tendencies. In addition, every elf bears a family name, typically a combination of other Elvish words. Some elves traveling among humans translate their family names into Common, but others retain the Elvish version.

Child Names:Little Jimmy, Dirge Jr., Mud Babies
Male Adult Names:Dominick, Shady, Vendrick, Fenris, Luther, Fourteen
Female Adult Names:Cricket, Celeste, Fawin, Diana, Shiela, Seventeen
Family Names (Common Translations):Angspar (Bad Decisions), Mistwood (Deceitful Philandering), Marchand (The Invisible Hand), Andolini (Guardian of the Young)
Your Faerie character has a variety of natural abilities.
Ability Score Increase. Your Dexterity score increases by 2.
Age. No one really knows how long the Faerie Folk live, some say that they are immortal spirits that make the Elves look young, and some think they exist for but a brief time.
Alignment. Faeries are usually the definition of Chaotic, tending to lean toward Chaotic Good and Chaotic Neutral.
Size. Faerie range from about 9 inches through 1'3" tall. Your size is Tiny.
Speed. Your base walking speed is 10 feet, and your base flying speed is 40 feet.

Darkvision. Accustomed to twilit forests and the night sky, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

Tiny Size. Halve Carry Capacity, Push, Drag, and Lift weight limits. You can attempt to hide even when you are obscured only by a creature that is at least one size larger than you, you can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours freely and you must share the space of a creature you are attempting to make a melee attack against. You have Disadvantage on Strength checks verses creatures larger then you.
Immortal. You are immune to aging and needing to breathe, though you still need to eat and drink.
Faerie Fleetness. Base Armor Class when not wearing armor is 13 + Dexterity Modifier.
Strange Diet. Due to their strange nature they gain Poison Resistance and Immunity to the Poisoned Condition.
Natural Acrobat. Faeries gain proficiency in the Acrobatics skill.
Languages. You can speak, read, and write Common and Sylvan.
Subrace. Ancient divides among the Faerie resulted in two main subraces: Sprites and Pixies.

Ability Score Increase. Your Charisma score increases by 2.
Seasonal Resistance. Spring (Acid), Summer (Fire), Autunm (Lightning), Winter (Cold)
Cantrip. You know the Druidcraft cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.

description.p: As a Sprite you are Green and radiate Nature Magic
Ability Score Increase. Your Charisma score increases by 2.
Landscape Boon. Wet (Swim Speed 40ft), Dry (Fire Resist), Cold (Cold Resist), Foliage (Advantage on Stealth), Wide Open (+20ft to Fly Speed)
Heart Sight. As an Action you know a creature's emotional state; within 30ft. If the creature also fails a DC: 8 + Prof + Wisdom, the Sprite knows their Alignment.

Sprite Poison. Once per Short/Long Rest; As an Action you throw a poisonous powder into the air. It spreads into a 15ft cone, each creature in the area of the powder must make a Constitution Saving Throw. The DC for this saving throw equals 8 + your Wisdom modifier + your proficiency bonus. A creature takes 2d6 poison damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. The Sprite may choose to deal no damage to instead incapacitated the targets for one round. The damage increases to 3d6 at 6th level, 4d6 at 11th level, and 5d6 at 16th level.
